ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned about some properties of non--parametric estimation using Sieve methods.
Taking Econometrics III with Xiaohong was a great experience. I learned a lot about extremum estimators, and semi/non-parametric estimation and inference.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The teaching by the professor was just --- I cannot think of a more approrpriate description --- bad. Not only was she difficult to understand, but each lecture lacked any kind of structure or cohesiveness. The course could be vastly improved by giving it a structure. Also, it would be helpful to present and discuss methods other than Sieve estimation, and to point out advantages and shortcomings of different methods. Generally, I would prefer instructors who do not mostly teach from their own papers. Given the circumstances and the material he was asked to cover, the TA did a great job.

The class was fantastic. It provided me with all the necessary resources to advance my knowledge in the field. I would have enjoyed doing an application of the methods we learned with real data (as well as the simulation study). In general, I prefer a class at a slower pace but with more detailed exposition. I would also prefer to have two classes per week rather than one class lasting longer.
Very disorganized and extremely difficult to follow

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: While the topics are interesting per se, I wouldn't recommend anybody to take this course.
I would definitely recommend this course to anyone interested in semi/nonparametric estimation and inference in econometrics.
